Package gameApp

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • gameApp.Main
  • public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application

    Main

    GameApp class extends from Application, launch different stages of game and store the present points player gains and the difficulty player reached by using SceneSwitcher. During the execution of the program, Main will keep supervise whether game status has been changed.
    Refactor:
    1. Removed the game scene initialisation code to improve code extendability and reusability;
    2. Removed the digit display function and transform it into part of the scene initialisation;
    3. The program will jump to start menu first SceneSwitcher.jumpToMenu()

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Kejia Wu, scykw1@nottingham.ac.uk
    See Also:
    Application, SceneSwitcher

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Store the present stage of the game and jump to the start menu SceneSwitcher.jumpToMenu() and launch the game menu scene as the initial game stage.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - : Solid parameter, change it to switch between different stages
        See Also:
        SceneSwitcher.jumpToMenu()

      • switchPreparation

        private static void switchPreparation​(java.lang.String filePath)

        This function prepares for the switch of scenes after the termination of game. It will judge whether player's present score is high enough to be recorded into the high score list.

        Parameters:
        filePath - : The absolute file path direct to the file storing game's present high score.

      • createTimer

        private static void createTimer()

        Observe the update of the points and life of the frogger and then switch to other pages if game is ended. Here a scene switcher is applied to professionally taking charge of the process of changing scenes.

        See Also:
        GameController

      • start

        public static void start()
        Creates and starts the timer and begins observing the change of frogger's status.
